entries.name: hello
entries.text: Hello, newcomer. What brings you to Southport?

children.name: lfq
children.response: Really? Well that's some great news for me. I'm missing my Prize-Winning Pumpkin. Could you find it for me?

children.name: yesToQuest
children.text: Yes, of course. Why do you think I'm even playing this game?
children.response: Great! It's around here somewhere. Find it and bring it back here.

children.name: noToQuest
children.text: No thanks. I don't like playing video games.
children.response: I understand. Best of luck to you, newcomer. Seriously. You're going to need it.

entries.name: pumpkinAccepted
entries.text: Have you found my pumpkin yet?

children.name: pumpkinFound
children.text: Yes, I have it right here!

children.name: pumpkinNotFound
children.response: Don't get discouraged just yet. There are a couple of pumpkin patches around here. That seems like a good place to start.

entries.name: melonCompleted
entries.text: I can't thank you enough for finding both my pumpkin AND my melon. You're the best! Maybe go see Old Zedd at the pub for a well-deserved drink. And maybe try an order of Ye Olde Cheez Fries.

entries.name: melonAccepted
entries.text: Hope you find the melon! It's around here somewhere.

entries.name: melonNotAccepted
entries.text: Hey, you did so well finding my pumpkin. Could I ask you another favor? I'm almost embarrassed by this, but . . . do you think you could also find my missing Big Fat Melon? I know, I know. I should keep better track of my vegetation.

children.name: noToQuest2
children.text: Actually, the pumpkin thing took it out of me. I'll just be on my way.
children.response: That's probably what I'd say too. Thanks, anyway. I'll ask the next newcomer to happen by.
